body_html:
That's partially yes, but not easy. You should transform a graph by using graph_transforms like:

bazel run tensorflow/tools/graph_transforms:transform_graph --
--in_graph="${SRC_FILE_NAME}"
--out_graph="${DST_FILE_NAME}"
--inputs="${INPUTS}" --outputs="${OUTPUTS}"
--transforms="
fuse_remote_graph(
input_types="${INPUT_TYPES}",
input_shapes="${INPUT_SHAPES}",
border_inputs="${BORDER_INPUTS}",
border_outputs="${BORDER_OUTPUTS}",
remote_fused_graph_executor_name="${REMOTE_FUSED_GRAPH_EXECUTOR_NAME}",
remote_fused_graph_node_name="${REMOTE_FUSED_GRAPH_NODE_NAME}"
)"

You should specify inputs (border_inputs) and outputs (border_outputs) of a subgraph where all ops are supported by HVX.

Currently, I'm away from this work and there are no good examples.

Anyway, the original topic has been already implemented which can be used via the command I noted above.

If you want to add further functionalities, contributions are always welcome.

If you want to add further functionalities, contributions are always welcome.
body:
That's partially yes, but not easy.  You should transform a graph by using graph_transforms like:

bazel run tensorflow/tools/graph_transforms:transform_graph -- \
--in_graph="${SRC_FILE_NAME}" \
--out_graph="${DST_FILE_NAME}" \
--inputs="${INPUTS}" --outputs="${OUTPUTS}" \
--transforms="\
fuse_remote_graph(\
input_types=\"${INPUT_TYPES}\",\
input_shapes=\"${INPUT_SHAPES}\",\
border_inputs=\"${BORDER_INPUTS}\",\
border_outputs=\"${BORDER_OUTPUTS}\",\
remote_fused_graph_executor_name=\"${REMOTE_FUSED_GRAPH_EXECUTOR_NAME}\",\
remote_fused_graph_node_name=\"${REMOTE_FUSED_GRAPH_NODE_NAME}\"\
)"

You should specify inputs (border_inputs) and outputs (border_outputs) of a subgraph where all ops are supported by HVX.

Currently, I'm away from this work and there are no good examples.

Anyway, the original topic has been already implemented which can be used via the command I noted above.

If you want to add further functionalities, contributions are always welcome.
